column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Oversite
#Text=“ It does n’t hurt , Gram , ” Renata says .
#Text=My sixteen - year - old daughter pulls up her T - shirt sleeve to show her bare arm , the skin summer brown and the muscle swelling slightly into smooth biceps , flawless .
#Text=“ I had it done when I was little and see , you ca n’t even tell . ”
#Text=My mother is sitting in the little examining room at the assisted living .
#Text=Everything is white and hospital - like but there ’s no examining couch .
#Text=There ’s just a desk , a little white table with two chairs and a scale .
#Text=The doctor , a woman I do n’t know , is sitting in the other chair .
#Text=My mother is bewildered , her face turned up towards me .
#Text=She ’s got Alzheimer ’s .
#Text=“ It ’s okay , Mom , ” I say .
#Text=She wants to understand , I can see that .
#Text=So I explain again .
#Text=“ It ’s an implant that will let them know where you are , and how you are .
#Text=It wo n’t hurt . ”
#Text=Her eyes water constantly , now .
#Text=In the time it takes me to explain she grasps and loses the words , grasps and loses phrases as they go past .
#Text=She looks at me and then at Renata , who is smiling , and finally submits uncomprehendingly .
#Text=We have worn her down .
#Text=The doctor bares my mother ’s arm , where the crepey flesh hangs loosely on the bones .
#Text=The doctor swabs her upper arm with antiseptic and says , “ I ’m going to give you something to numb it , okay ? ”
#Text=To me the doctor says in her normal voice , “ It ’s just a little lidocaine . ”
#Text=I do n’t like the doctor , but I do n’t know why .
#Text=She is no - nonsense .
#Text=She has professional hair , lightly streaked .
#Text=This is no reason to dislike her .
#Text=My mother winces at the injection and is surprised again .
#Text=She looks up at me , at Renata .
#Text=We are smiling , both of us .
#Text=“ Okay , ” my mother says .
#Text=What is okay ?
#Text=I have no idea .
#Text=We wait for a few minutes .
#Text=My mother says , “ Is it time to go ? ”
#Text=“ Not yet , ” I say .
#Text=“ They ’re going to give you an injection . ”
#Text=“ What ? ” my mother says .
#Text=“ They ’re going to implant a chip .
#Text=It will help them take care of you . ”
#Text=I try to say it every time as if it was the first time I said it .
#Text=I do n’t want to embarrass her .
#Text=Her head swings around , from Renata to me to the doctor and then back to Renata .
#Text=“ It ’s okay , Gram , ” Renata says .
#Text=“ Renata , ” my mother says .
#Text=The doctor has an injection gun and while my mother is focused on my daughter , she puts it firmly against my mother ’s arm and puts the chip in .
#Text=“ Oh ! ” says my mother .
#Text=It ’s another low - grade moment of horror , but I think about that particular time with my mother because Renata was there and we were united , she and I .
#Text=So that ’s a good memory .
#Text=I come back to it a lot .
#Text=In the background , shining , is Renata , who is young and healthy and good , raising her arm to show her grandmother that the chip is nothing , nothing at all .
#Text=The last two nights I have dreamed of dogs in trouble .
#Text=I do n’t dream about Renata , although when the dreams wake me up , it ’s thinking about Renata that keeps me awake .
#Text=The first night I dreamed of seeing a stray dog and not stopping to pick it up although it was wandering in an empty parking lot near a busy road .
#Text=That was the first night Renata did n’t come home and it does n’t take Freud to figure out what that meant .
#Text=Seventeen - year - olds sleep on friends ’ couches , I know .
#Text=Or Renata might be sleeping in her car .
#Text=The second night I dreamed that I was on a desert island and Sonia , our golden retriever , was with me .
#Text=There was some horrible fate impending for Sonia and I had to kill her before something worse happened .
#Text=I laid her down on some sticks .
#Text=She trusts me , she ’s more my dog than anyone ’s , and she did n’t like it but for me she lay there .
#Text=In my dream I told her , “ Stay , Sonia . Stay . ”
#Text=She stayed because I held her there by looking at her , the way you can sometimes will a dog into submission .
#Text=She stayed while I lit the fire .
#Text=And then the horror of it all hit me and I said , “ Sonia , up ! ”
#Text=And I woke up .
#Text=That was last night , the second night Renata did n’t come home .
#Text=Slave and murdered , if not dubbed so , the day the day a sudden ray of the moon poured at the garden and into the sea .
